oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian ceramic animal figurine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian ceramic head possibly representative of a monkey. Evidence of prognathism even with breakage, large ears and large concentric circle eyes. Some detail evident before the breakage at the neck but it cannot be made out.
A lot of breakage all over; at the neck and nose/mouth area and the ears. Regular wear.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
